shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Introduction (fols. 1v-4v) - Canon tables (fols. 1v-4v) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 5ra-50vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 66 titles (5rv) - Bǝsratä Matewos “The Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 6ra-50vb) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 50vb-) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 49 titles (fols. 50vb-51va) - Bǝsratä Marqos “The Gospel of Mark” (fols. 52ra-76rb) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 78ra-152vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 84 titles (fols. 76rb-77rb) - Bǝsratä Luqas “The Gospel of Luke” (fols. 78ra-152vb) V) Gospel of John (fols. 120rb-154rb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 19 titles (fol. 120rb) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “The Gospel of John” (fols. 121ra-154rb).

copyists.copyist: The scribe is not mentioned, but the hand is undoubtedly that of Zä-Dǝngǝl (who copied Mss. AQG-002, QQM-006 and some others).

txstates.txstate: Spine, endbands and threads of the stitching are missing. The quires are unbound, not connected to the boards.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather (the quires are unbound, not connected to the boards; the leather slightly comes off from the back board). Two pairs of sewing stations (remains of the threads of the stitching are visible on both boards).

squires.squire: I (2-1/s.l.: 2, 1 is cut/fol. 1rv) – II(4/fols. 2r-5v) – III(10/s.l. 6 stub after 4; 5 stub after 6/fols. 6r-15v) – IV(9/s.l.: 5 stub after 4/fols. 16r-24v) – V(11/s.l.: 7 stub after 4/fols. 25r-35v) – VI(10/s.l.: 6 stub after 4/fols. 36r-45v) – VII(6/fols. 46r-51v) – VIII (6/fols. 52r-57v) – IX(8/fols. 58r-65v) – X(8/fols. 66r-73v) – XI(9/s.l.: 6 stub after 4; 4 stub after 3; 5 stub after 4/fols. 74r-82v) – XII(12/fols. 83r-94v) – XIII(8/fols. 95r-102v) – XIV(11/s.l.: 6 stub after 5/fols. 103r-113v) – XV(11/s.l.: 6 stub after 5/fols. 114r-124v) – XVI(10/s.l.: 5 stub after 4; 6 stub after 5/fols. 125r-134v) – XVII(10/ s.l.: 5 stub after 4; 6 stub after 5/ 135r-144v) – XVIII(9/s.l.: 5 stub after 5/fols. 145r-153v) – XIX(1/s.l.: 1 stub before 1/fol. 154rv) – B(1/s.l.: 1 stub after 1/fol. 155rv).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are clearly visible (made with a tool with a broad spike). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is usually written above the ruling, sometimes below the ruling (s. fols. 103r -117r, 125v, 130r)

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; grids of the Canon tables (fols. 2r-4v); 1st, 2nd, 5th, 6th lines in the beginning and in the end of the columns, in the incipit pages of the Gospels; titles of the Gospels; two titles of the chapters of the Gospel of Matthew, the word mǝʿǝraf; elements of punctuation marks; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ምዕራ for ምዕራፍ: throughout the text ም for ምዕራፍ: fol. 75va

otherdetails.otherdetail: -The scribe does not attend to the ruling lines. However, the number of the ruling lines and the written lines is equal. -The number of the ruling lines is unstable, between 25-29. -Canon tables are drawn carelessly. -Canon table in fol. 2v is not finished. - Numbers of the “tituli” are missing in all the Gospels. - Lack of the title of the Gospel of Matthew. -The chapters of the Gospels are not numerated. -Only some chapters of the Gospel of Matthew are entitled. If this is so, the title is written in the upper margin. The remaining Gospels do not have titles within the text. -The word mǝʿǝraf corresponds to either a chapter or a section within a chapter. -Throughout each Gospel a continuous number is given to selected lines (They are written in the margins). -Punctuation sign ቁም (qum) between two black dashes ended with four red circles, or between two red dashes, (or “qu”, fol. 79vb) appears on numerous fols., e.g.: 41ra, 42va, 43va, 45va, 46rb, 48vb, 49ra, 49vab, 50va, 56rb, 60vb, 111vab, 113vab, 117rb, 118rab, 118vb, 119va, 121ra, 121vab, 122ra, 123rab, 127rab, 140rb. It seems to mark the beginning and the end of the passage assigned to be read on a certain day, s. 45vb-46rb. -Fols. 118vb, 119va, 132va, 134rb contain, beside ቁም (qum), a word አልዕል (ʾalʿǝl), perhaps indicating that the reading is preceded by singing “Hallelujah”.

extras.extra: - Crude notes in pen, usually indicating feasts and readings, fols.: 23r, 28r, 29rv, 36v, 37r, 39r, 40r, 41v, 75r, 96r, 100r, 101v, 122r, 135r, 144r, 146r, 155v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings are indicated by the names of the feasts written between two black lines, usually in the upper margin, rarely in the bottom one: fols. 12v, 17r, 18v, 22r, 22v, 24v, 25v, 43r, 44v, 45v, 48r, 49r, 67r, 81r, 81v, 82r, 92r, 105r, 111r, 113v, 116v, 118v, 119v, 121r, 121v, 122v, 126v, 132v, 134r, 137r, 140v, 141r, 141v, 142v, 146r, 147r, 148v, 151v.
